trans-unit.source: Represents a feed item, for example an RSS `<item>` or an Atom `<entry>`.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance is written to an `<entry>` element.
The following table shows how each property defined for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is serialized for Atom 1.0.
SyndicationItem property
Serialized form
Attribute in the `<entry>` element.
An `<author>` element for each author in the collection.
A`<category>` element.
A`<content>` element.
A`<contributor>` element for each contributor in the collection.
A`<rights>` element.
Element in the `<entry>` element.
An `<id>` element.
An `<updated>` element.
A `<link>` element for each link in the collection.
A `<published>` element.
A `<source>` element.
A `<summary>` element.
A `<title>` element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance is written to an `<item>` element.
The following table shows how each property defined for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is serialized for RSS 2.0.
SyndicationItem property
Serialized form
Attribute in the `<item>` element.

A `<managingEditor>` if only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection; otherwise, the `<a10:author>` element for each author in the collection.
A `<category>` element.
An `<a10:content>` element.
An `<a10:contributor>` element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.
A `<copyright>` element.
Element in the `<item>` element.
An `<a10:id>` element.
An `<a10:updated>` element.
A `<link>` element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A> collection.
A `<pubDate>` element.
A `<source>` element.
A `<description>` element.
A `<title>` element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance used to initialize the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> class with the specified title, content, and link.
The item title.
The item content.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> class.
The title of the syndication item.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent"></xref> instance containing the content of the syndication item.
The ID of the syndication item.
The <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> that contains the last time the syndication item was last updated.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> class.
The title of the syndication item.
The content of the syndication item.
The ID of the syndication item.
The <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> that contains the last time the syndication item was last updated.
Adds a *permalink* to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref>.
A permalink is a static URI that points to some content on the Web.
Gets the attribute extensions for the syndication item.
The Syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
When serialized for Atom 1.0, the custom attribute is written to an `<entry>` element.
When serialized for RSS 2.0, the custom attribute is written to an `<item>` element.
For a complete example that shows how to add an attribute extension, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/loosely-typed-extensions-sample.md) sample.
A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.
Gets the authors of the syndication item.

When serializing to Atom 1.0, an `<author>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection.
When serializing to RSS 2.0.

a `<managingEditor>` element is written if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection has only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson>, otherwise a `<a10:author>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> objects that represent the authors of the syndication item.
Gets and sets the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
The base URI of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref>.
Gets the syndication categories for the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0, a `<category>` element is created for each category in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A> collection.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> objects that represent the categories of the syndication item.
Creates a copy of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
Gets and sets the content of the syndication item.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent> is a base class for all syndication content types.
The [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] defines the following syndication content types:
You can assign this property to any of these content types (or possibly a user-defined type derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent>).
For Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A> property is serialized to a `<content>` element.

For RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A> property is serialized to a `<description>` element for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>, a `<a10:content>` element for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent"></xref> instance that contains the content of the syndication item.
Gets the contributors of the syndication item.

When serialized to Atom 1.0, a `<contributor>` element is created for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, a `<a10:contributor>` element is created for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> objects that represent the contributors of the syndication item.
Gets and sets the copyright information for the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to a `<rights>` element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<a10:rights>` element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent"></xref> instance that represents copyright information.
Creates a new category.
This does not add the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A> collection.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> object.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.

The new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> instance is not automatically added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance used to call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.CreateLink> method.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.
Creates a new person.

This does not add the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> object.
Gets the element extensions contained in the syndication item.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
Any valid XML element can be added as an extension provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
When serialized, extensions are written like any other XML element.
For a complete example that shows how to add element extensions, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/loosely-typed-extensions-sample.md) sample.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationElementExtensionCollection"></xref> that contains the element extensions.
Gets an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
RSS 2.0 allows elements and attributes that are not in its specification only if they are within a namespace.
When the `serializedExtensionsAsAtom` parameter is `true`, the formatter automatically adds the "a10" namespace to all extensions; otherwise, the extensions are not serialized.
A value that specifies whether to serialize element and attribute extensions with an Atom 1.0 namespace.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets and sets the ID of the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to the `<id>` element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to the `<guid>` element.
The ID of the syndication item.
Gets and sets the last updated time for the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to an `<updated>` item.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to an `<a10:updated>` item.
A <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> instance that represents the time the syndication item was last updated.
Gets the links contained in the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, a `<link>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, an `<a10:link>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> objects.
Loads a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Loads a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> derived object from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
Use this method when you are loading a syndication item into a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref>-derived class to load.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> derived object that contains the syndication item.
Gets and sets the publish date for the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to a `<published>` element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<pubDate>` element.
A <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> object that represents the publish date for the syndication item.
Write the syndication item to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in Atom 1.0 format.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
Write the syndication item to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in RSS 2.0 format.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
Gets and sets the source feed of the syndication item.
This property is not automatically set when you add a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>—you must explicitly set it.
When serialized to Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<source>` element.
The contents of that element vary depending on the format you serialize to.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance where the syndication item is located.
Gets and sets the summary of the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to a `<summary>` element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<description>` element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent"></xref> that contains a summary of the item.
Gets and sets the title of the syndication item.
When serialized to Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<title>` element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent"></xref> object that contains the title of the syndication item.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the `<entry>` (for Atom 1.0) or `<item>` (for RSS 1.0) element, depending upon the syndication version being used.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Attempts to parse content.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom content.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized content.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The content type of the content.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent"></xref> instance to load the parsed content into.
A value that specifies whether the content was parsed successfully.
Attempts to parse an element extension.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Writes the attribute extensions to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> using the specified syndication version.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the `<entry>` (for Atom 1.0) or `<item>` (for RSS 1.0) element, depending upon the syndication version being used.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
Writes the element extensions to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> using the specific syndication version.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
